sentences.en: a bankrupt electrical company
sentences.cn: 一家破产的电力公司

sentences.en: Amalgamation was the only alternative to going bankrupt.
sentences.cn: 联合起来是避免破产的唯一途径.

sentences.en: Foolish expenditures will bankrupt him.
sentences.cn: 胡乱的花费将使他破产。

sentences.en: He argued forcefully and convincingly that they were likely to bankrupt the budget.
sentences.cn: 他坚持认为他们可能会突破预算，而且理由非常有说服力。

sentences.en: He has the dubious distinction of being the first railway baron to go bankrupt.
sentences.cn: 他担着首位破产铁路大亨的名声,这也算是种荣誉吧.

sentences.en: He was declared bankrupt after failing to pay a £114m loan guarantee.
sentences.cn: 由于无力偿还1.14亿英镑的贷款担保，他被宣布破产。

sentences.en: If my advice had been acted upon, the firm would not have gone bankrupt.
sentences.cn: 如果我的建议被采纳, 公司就不会破产了.

sentences.en: If the firm cannot sell its products, it will go bankrupt.
sentences.cn: 如果公司的产品卖不出去，它就会倒闭。

sentences.en: In 1977 he was declared bankrupt (=  by a court  ) .
sentences.cn: 1977年，他被宣布破产。

sentences.en: In total, 80% of bankrupts are men.
sentences.cn: 总体来看，有80%的破产者为男性。

sentences.en: It is proving hard to work out the value of bankrupt firms' assets.
sentences.cn: 清算破产公司的资产值其实很困难。

sentences.en: It was touch and go whether we'd go bankrupt.
sentences.cn: 我们是否会破产还很难说。

sentences.en: Johns had been nearly bankrupted through a failed business venture.
sentences.cn: 约翰斯因为商业投资失败几近破产。

sentences.en: Mr Trent lost his house when he was made bankrupt .
sentences.cn: 特伦特先生破产以后房子也没有了。

sentences.en: Seventeen years of war left the country bankrupt.
sentences.cn: 17年的战争把国家耗空了。

sentences.en: That factory has gone bankrupt.
sentences.cn: 那家工厂倒了.

sentences.en: The company is bankrupt.
sentences.cn: 公司已经破产.

sentences.en: The company was adjudged bankrupt.
sentences.cn: 该公司被宣判破产。

sentences.en: The court adjudicated the company bankrupt.
sentences.cn: 法庭宣判那家公司破产.

sentences.en: The enemy's scheme went bankrupt.
sentences.cn: 敌人的计谋破产了.

sentences.en: The firm went bankrupt before the building work was completed.
sentences.cn: 建筑工程尚未竣工，公司就破产了。

sentences.en: The move to the market nearly bankrupted the firm and its director.
sentences.cn: 走向市场的行动几乎使这家公司及其董事破产。

sentences.en: They went bankrupt in 1993.
sentences.cn: 他们于1993年破产。

trans.tran_en: without enough money to pay what you owe
someone who has officially said that they cannot pay their debts
to make a person, business, or country bankrupt or very poor
to make a person, business, or country bankrupt or very poor
